intro: Cupia mollissima, commonly known as the silky cupia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cupia mollissima thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
